intro: Otholobium thomii, commonly known as the narrow-leafed everlasting pea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with small, narrow leaves and produces clusters of pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. Otholobium thomii is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in dry climates. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and forage for various wildlife species.
